meanings.def: a number of things of the same type which are growing or fastened together
examples: a bunch of bananas, grapes, etc.
She picked me a bunch of flowers.
She put all the flowers together in one big bunch.

meanings.def: a large amount of something; a large number of things or people
examples: I have a whole bunch of stuff to do this morning.
The people that I work with are a great bunch.
bunch of somebody They're a great bunch of people/guys/kids.
They are a bunch of amateurs.
He's been hanging out with a bunch of yobs and hooligans.
The members were a genuinely friendly and open bunch.
They're a lovely bunch of youngsters.

meanings.def: long hair that is divided in two and tied at each side of the head
examples: She wore her hair in bunches.

meanings.def: a person or thing that is a little better than the rest of a group, although none are very good
the best out of a group of people or things
to become angry, confused or upset

idioms.idiom: the best of a bad bunch/lot
idioms.def: a person or thing that is a little better than the rest of a group, although none are very good
the best out of a group of people or things

idioms.idiom: get your panties in a bunch
idioms.def: to become angry, confused or upset

related: get your panties in a bunch

meanings.def: to become tight or to form tight folds; to make something do this
examples: His muscles bunched under his shirt.
bunch (something) up Her skirt had bunched up round her waist.
bunch something His forehead was bunched in a frown.
